data.title: The best family friendly day trip to Szekesfehervar, Hungary
data.meta_description: Szekesfehervar, Hungary offers a perfect destination for a family-friendly trip with its rich history and captivating attractions. Explore the grandiose Bory Castle, an enchanting fortress filled with stunning sculptures and a whimsical atmosphere that will captivate both children and adults. Additionally, immerse yourself in the city's rich history by visiting the Royal Palace, where you can witness magnificent exhibitions and learn about the royal heritage of Hungary.
data.text:
Plane

The best way to get to Szekesfehervar by plane is to fly into Budapest Ferenc Liszt International Airport and then take a 40-minute taxi or train ride to the city. The airport is located about 60 kilometers away from Szekesfehervar and offers numerous international flights from major cities around the world.

Car

The best way to get to Szekesfehervar by car is to take the M7 motorway from Budapest. The journey takes about 45 minutes, and there are numerous car rental companies operating in the city which provide cars for hire.

Train

The best way to get to Szekesfehervar by train is to take a domestic train from Budapest's Nyugati station. The journey takes about an hour, and trains run at regular intervals. Szekesfehervar also has its own train station, making it easy to get around the city once you arrive.

Boat

There is no direct way to get to Szekesfehervar by boat as the city is landlocked. However, if you're looking for a scenic way to travel, you can take a boat ride along the Danube river from Budapest to nearby towns such as Visegrad and Esztergom which are located along the river.

Bus

The best way to get to Szekesfehervar by bus is to take a coach from Budapest's Nepliget bus station. The journey takes about an hour, and coaches run at regular intervals throughout the day. Once you arrive in Szekesfehervar, the city's bus network is efficient and easy to navigate.
